title.narrative: Right Here, Right Now Strategic Partnership

description.narrative: The Right Here Right Now (RHRN) program aims to improve the protection, respect and fulfilment of the sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) of young people. The program is implemented in 10 low-and middle-income countries in Africa, Asia, Latin America and the Caribbean. The activities focus on: • freedom from stigma, discrimination and violence; • access to comprehensive youth-friendly services; • access to comprehensive information; • space for young people’s voices. The program is a strategic partnership between Rutgers, the Asian-pacific Resource and Research Centre for Women (ARROW), CHOICE for Youth and Sexuality (CHOICE), Dance4life, HIVOS, International Planned Parenthood Federation African Region (IPPF AR), the Latin American and Caribbean Women’s Health Network (LACWHN) and the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

receiver-org.narrative: IPPF African Region _Consortium meber Right here Right Now

G. (Sub)regional and international bodies adopt and promote progressive and inclusive SRHR norms, standards and policies and promote accountability.

description.narrative: International bodies: CSW, CPD, HLPF, UPR, treaty bodies; Regional bodies Latin Amerca & Caribbean: Montevideo Conference, Conference on Women in LAC, Org. Of American States, CARICOM; Regional bodies Africa: Maputo Plan of Action, UNECA (SDGs), ESA commitment, ACHPR Resolution 275, East Africa SRHR bill, SADCC Parliamentary Forum; Regional bodies Asia: ESCAP, ASEAN, SAARC; Regional bodies Europe: EU Consensus on Development, UNECE SDGs

title.narrative: G.1: # of outcome and other relevant documents of relevant regional and international forums that maintain or strengthen language on SRHR, disaggregated by level (regional and international).

description.narrative: Other relevant documents can refer to: resolutions/ declarations/ general comments/ recommendations. Strengthen language can also include new formulations that are considered progressive.

comment.narrative: Baseline standard set at zero as indicator measures changes within the programme’s timeline.

2017: Montevideo Conference: maintained, Org. of American States: strengthened, HLPF LAC: strengthened, Maputo Plan of Action: strengthened, UNECA: maintained, ESA commitment: maintained, East African SRHR bill: maintained (draft); SADC parliamentary forum: maintained, ESCAP: maintained, EU Consensus on Development: maintained, UNECE SDGs 2017: Strengthened

2018: III LAC Regional Conference on Population and Development (Montevideo Consensus): maintained, Org. of American States: strengthened, HLPF LAC: strengthened, Regional Consultation prior to CSW63: strengthened, Maputo Plan of Action: maintained, UNECA: strengthened, ESA commitment: maintained, SADC parliamentary forum: strong, ACHPR Resolution 275: maintained, NEAPACOH: strengthened, APFSD: maintained, APPC: maintained, UNECE ICPD+25: Strengthened
APFSD : 1 Maintained , UNESCAP - 6th session of the Committee on Social Development : 1 Indicator framework adopted , UNECA (SDGs): 1 Strengthened, OAS: 1 Maintained.

APFSD: strengthened, UNECA: strengthened, ACHPR 64th session: strengthened, ACHPR 65th session: strengthened, NEAPACOH: strengthened, Beijing+25 Africa Regional Review: strengthened, OAS: maintained, Forum of Countries of LAC for Sustainable Development: maintained.
CSW 2017: maintained CPD 2017: maintained (no outcome document) HLPF 2017: maintained
CSW62: strengthened, HLPF: maintained, Human Rights Council 39th Session: strengthened, CEDAW Nepal: strengthened
CSW63: strengthened, CPD52: maintained, HLPF: maintained, HRC 41st session: 5 adopted resolutions, Nairobi Summit ICPD+25: strengthened

CSW64: Strengthened, CPD53: no outcome , HLPF: no outcome , Human Rights Council 43rd Session: 1 Revised resolution , Human Rights Council 44th Session: 2 Adopted resolutions , Human Rights Council 45th Session: 2 Revised resolutions.
Total for entire programme duration. See reporting lines per year for description.
Total for entire programme duration. See reporting lines per year for description.

title.narrative: G.2: # of oral and/or written statements/ commitments/ initiatives on SRHR in relevant regional and international fora, disaggregated by level (regional and international).

comment.narrative: Baseline standard set at zero as indicator measures changes within the programme’s timeline.

APPC: 4 (Bangladesh x2, Nepal, Indonesia), UNECA: 2 (Senegal, Uganda), SADC Parliamentary Forum: 4 (Zimbabwe x4), NEAPACOH: 10 (Kenya, Senegal x3, Uganda x3, Zimbabwe x3), OAS: 2 (LAC), UNECE: 2 (The Netherlands x2)

CSW 2017: 7 (Bangladesh, Indonesia, Kenya, Nepal, Senegal, Uganda, the Netherlands) CPD 2017: 6 (Bangladesh, Indonesia, Nepal, Pakistan, Uganda, the Netherlands) HLPF 2017: 10 (Bangladesh, Indonesia, Kenya, Nepal, Uganda, Zimbabwe, the Netherlands x4) UPR 2017: 2 (Indonesia, the Netherlands)

CSW62: 1 (The Netherlands), CPD51: 5 (Bangladesh, Indonesia, Nepal, the Netherlands x2), HLPF: 10 (Bangladesh, Bolivia, Caribbean countries, Honduras, Indonesia, Kenya, Nepal, The Netherlands, Senegal, Uganda), CEDAW Nepal: 1 (Nepal).

CSW63: 2 (Honduras 1, Netherlands 1), CPD52: 6 (Bangladesh 1, Indonesia 1, Nepal 1, Netherlands 2, Cross-regional (signed by among others Nepal and Netherlands), HLPF: 4 (Cross-regional, Indonesia 1, Netherlands 1, Pakistan 1), HRC 41st session: 4 (Nepal 1, Netherlands 3), Nairobi Summit ICPD+25: 6 (Cross-regional, Netherlands 1, Nepal 1, Pakistan 1, Indonesia 1, Bolivia 1)

title.narrative: E. During negotiations, meetings and relevant processes on SRHR, there is an increased support base of countries, donors and multilateral institutions for progressive and inclusive SRHR norms, standards and policies and for improved accountability
E.1: # of references related to SRHR included in key policy/strategy documents/ implementation guides by UNFPA, WHO, UNESCO, UNAIDS.

comment.narrative: Baseline standard set at zero as indicator measures changes within the programme’s timeline
Total for entire programme duration. See reporting lines per year for description.

UNFPA - AA-HA Framework (2017): 50; WHO - Report to WHA on Global Strategy (2017): 15; WHO - Report to WHA on SDG3 (2017): 1; High Level Working Group on Health and Human Rights (WHO and OHCHR) - Leading the realization of human rights to health and through health (2017): 50; Independent Accountability Panel - Transformative accountability for adolescents, annual IAP report 2017: 50.
With the start of 2018, RHRN decided to no longer focus its advocacy on policy/strategy documents/ implementation guides by UNFPA, WHO, UNESCO, UNAIDS. Therefore, this indicator is no longer measured
